_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES AT OUR FACILITY.

THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH THE OSHA REG 29 CFR 1910.11 AND IT IS OUR POLICY TO COMPLY TO ALL APPLICABLE FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL LAWS. IF AN EMERGENCY WERE TO OCCUR OUR POLICY IS TO NOTIFY THE ALEXANDER FIRE DEPT. AND MCKENZIE COUNTY LEPC AND ASK FOR THEIR ASSISTANCE.

DESCRIPTION OF FACILITY AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE HAULED.

OUR FACILITY IS AN ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE FACILITY. THE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS USED IN THE AGRICULTURE INDUSTRY. WE BRING THE PRODUCT IN BY TRANSPORT TRUCK AND UNLOAD INTO THE STORAGE TANK.  AT THIS FACILITY THE CUSTOMER TANKS ARE FILLED ON SITE, WHEN THE CUSTOMER HAS NEED FOR PRODUCT HE BRINGS HIS EMPTY TRAILER IN AND PICKS UP A FULL TRAILER. THIS SITE IS MANNED BY ONE PERSON THRU THE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA SEASON.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS.

THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S ACCIDENT PREVENTION RULE AND APPLICABLE STATE AND LOCAL CODES AND REGULATIONS. THIS ANHYDROUS AMMONIA SYSTEM IS DESIGNED, INSTALLED AND MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL STATE, FEDERAL AND LOCAL LAWS.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

WE HAVE NEVER HAD AN ACCIDENT INVOLVING ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT CAUSED DEATHS, INJURIES, PROPERTY OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE OR EVACUATIONS.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY INVOLVING OUR ANHYDROUS SYSTEM, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY THE LOCAL FIRE DEPT. AND THE LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COORDINATOR AND HAVE THEM RESPOND TO THE EMERGENCY.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY IS TO CONTINUE TO INSPECT, UPDATE AND MAINTAIN THE EQUIPMENT AND CONTINUE TO PROVIDE TRAINING FOR THE EMPLOYEE'S IN THE HANDLING OF THE PRODUCT AND OPERATION OF THE PLANT. THIS FACILITY IS NOT MANNED, EXCEPT FOR THE ANHYDROUS SEASON.
